data.title: 2023 Ballon d’Or ceremony: Messi and Bonmatí take home the trophy | Full list of award winners
data.meta_description: Aitana Bonmatí and Lionel Messi are the 2023 Ballon d’Or winners. Messi wins the award for the eighth time.
data.text:
2023 Ballon d’Or: as it happened

BALLON D'OR

The Ballon d’Or is looking for an heir post-Messi

No sooner are the tables being cleared and parties being enjoyed, than people begin thinking about what players are likely to take the top spots in Ballons d'Or to come.

Messi already made his thoughts clear and Manu and Calum consider the hottest young prospects of the future.

as.com

That’s all from us. World Cup winners Lionel Messi and Aitana Bonmatí take home the Ballon d'Or awards.

Thanks for your company today.

See you soon!

as.com

List of award winners

Aitana Bonmatí - Women's Ballon d'Or

Lionel Messi - Men's Ballon d'Or

Vinícius Júnior - Socrates Trophy

Erling Haaland - Gerd Müller Trophy

Jude Bellingham - Kopa Trophy

Manchester City - Club of the Year

Emiliano Martínez - Yashin Trophy

FC Barcelona - Women's Club of the Year

as.com

BALLON D'OR

Which clubs have won the most men’s Ballon d’Or awards?

It was a gala night for Major League Soccer as Inter Miami star Lionel Messi became the first player from a team outside of Europe to win the Ballon d’Or.

as.com

Messi goes backstage

He's well used to all the attention by now!

as.com

BALLON D'OR

Who has won the Ballon d’Or more times, Messi or Ronaldo?

Lionel Messi extends his Ballon d'Or lead over Cristiano Ronaldo.

as.com

Inter Miami have a Ballon d'Or winner

The MLS club have a Ballon d'Or winner in their ranks.

as.com

Ballon d'Or 2023

Lionel Messi is joined on stage by his three sons after collecting his eighth Ballon d'Or.

as.com

BALLON D'OR

What is the Socrates Award at the Ballon d’Or? Vinicius Junior wins humanitarian award

The 23-year-old received the honour for his humanitarian work. Vinicius’ foundation, Vini.Jr Institute, funds an educational app for underprivileged children in Brazil.

The app provides free access to educational resources for children. This year his personal contribution to the foundation is set to exceed $1 million and will rise to $2.5 million in 2024.

as.com

"This comes on the back of what I achieved with Argentina. We came here with Lautaro, Juli, Dibu... it's a gift for the group and for the whole coaching staff. It's a gift for Argentina and for what we achieved.

"I don't want to leave without talking about Haaland and Mbappé... they had spectacular seasons. I have no doubt that they are going to win this award.

"I want to remember Diego (Maradona) on his birthday. There are many players here who loved football as much as he did."

Lionel Messi, Ballon d'Or winner

Messi's three sons have joined him on the stage for a magical moment for his family.

as.com

At the 2022 World Cup with Argentina, Messi signed off with seven goals and three assists, two in the final, defeating France and Mbappé, his former PSG team-mate.

as.com

The Argentine star has beaten Erling Haaland and Kylian Mbappé, who both, you imagine, will eventually have their time.

as.com

Top 5

Erling Haaland is second. Kylian Mbappé is third.

as.com

"They are special, these awards, but the most important thing is the collective."

Lionel Messi, Inter Miami forward

Messi!

It's been a phenomenal career for the Inter Miami player.

as.com

Messi wins the Ballon d'Or for the eighth time!

Messi wins it again!

The best ever!

as.com

And the 2023 Ballon d'Or winner is... Lionel Messi

as.com

Haaland, Mbappé or Messi?

Who is it going to be?

as.com

"I owe Sir Bobby Charlton everything. We'll miss him dearly. He'll be missed greatly by the footballing world."

David Beckham, Former Man Utd player

"Paris is a very special city for me. And on the field, it was even more special. To win the club's first title in 19 years was very special. I played my 100th game for my country here, too."

David Beckham, Inter Miami owner

David Beckham takes to the stage!

as.com

We're getting closer to the Men's Ballon d'Or winner!

as.com

Women's top 5!

Australia's Sam Kerr finishes in second place, while Salma is third. So much talent in that top 5!

as.com

Aitana: "This is a dream for me. I'm so lucky to be able to play for a club like Barcelona."

as.com

Legend!

Barcelona legend!

as.com

Bonmatí wins!

Thoroughly deserved! She's been magnificent for both Spain and Barcelona.

as.com

Bonmatí: "I wouldn't be here without my team-mates.

"Thanks to my family, friends and those who help out."

as.com

Women's Ballon d'Or winner

Aitana Bonmatí is the winner!

as.com

Rodri - 5th

A fine campaign with City sees Rodri in the top 5.

as.com

Vinícius Júnior - 6th

Vinícius is 6th!

as.com

Julián Álvarez - 7th

The Man City forward comes 7th!

as.com

Women's 2023 Ballon d'Or

We're getting closer!

7. Alexandra Popp (Wolfsburg and Germany)

6. Olga Carmona (Barcelona and Spain)

5. Mary Earps (Manchester United and England)

as.com

Man City midfielder Bernardo Silva: “We have so many nominees in both the men’s and women’s categories... it’s a sign that the club is doing something great.”

as.com

Club of the Year

City have FIVE players in the Ballon d'Or top 10!

as.com

Ferran Soriano, City CEO, says: "We're here because of these extraordinary players, but behind the scenes, there are many people working extremely hard."

as.com

Man City: treble winners

Man City win the Club of the Year award!

FC Barcelona Femení win best Women's club.

as.com

Haaland's advice

"It's my job to score! If I'm going to give advice, it would be to stay sharp and to stay hungry.

"I have amazing team-mates and I'm at an amazing club."

as.com

Haaland picks up the award

He's still only 23. Frightening!

as.com

Haaland scored an incredible 52 goals in 53 games for Man City last season!

We're watching a montage of those goals now.

as.com

Erling Haaland on winning the award: "I'd like to thank everyone close to me."

as.com

Erling Haaland wins the Gerd Muller Trophy

Lineker presents the trophy to the Man City striker.

as.com

Top keepers!

Dibu comes out on top, but there are some excellent netminders on that list!

as.com

Gary Lineker will present the Gerd Muller Trophy!

as.com

Aston Villa congratulate their keeper on his award.

as.com

Dibu wins

The Villa shot-stopper picks up the award.

as.com

And his father joins him on stage. It's an emotional moment between the pair. Leo Messi looks on with a huge smile on his face.

as.com

Martínez won the 2022 World Cup with Argentina in Qatar.

as.com

Yashin Trophy winner: Emiliano Martínez

Emiliano Martínez wins the Yashin Trophy award!

as.com

Yashin Trophy

It's time for the Yashin Trophy!

as.com

Beckham x Novak

as.com

Modric is in the top 10

Victor Osimhen comes in 8th place after helping Napoli to the Serie A title last season.

Man City's Bernardo Silva is 9th.

as.com

Linda Caicedo - 9th

The wonderfully-gifted Colombian star is 9th!

as.com

Women's Top 10

England's Rachel Daly makes her way into this year's top 10!

as.com

Ballon d'Or Top 10

We’re now in the top 10!

Luka Modric (10th)

Bernardo Silva (9th)

Victor Osimhen (8th)

as.com

Vinícius Júnior recognised for work off the pitch

He continues to use his platforms to help those less fortunate.

as.com

Vinícius Jr wins the Socrates award!

The Real Madrid player has picked up the award for the work he has done to help children in Brazil.

The Brazil international has invested a reported €4m for his Vini Jr. Institute, an education app for students from poor backgrounds.

Drogba also thanks Vinícius for the work he has done to tackle racism around the world.

as.com

Kopa top 3

Jamal Musiala has finished second for the 2023 Kopa Trophy, while Barcelona midfielder Pedri is third.

as.com

Bellingham's moment

And it's well-deserved.

as.com

Kopa Trophy winner: Jude Bellingham

Bellingham was excellent for Borussia Dortmund, who he helped guide to a Bundesliga title race last season.

He has scored 13 goals in 13 games for Real Madrid this season.

as.com

Jude Bellingham on stage: "I want to thank everyone who has gotten me to this point. The support means a lot."

as.com

And the winner of the Kopa Trophy is Jude Bellingham!

as.com

Kopa Trophy

It's time to present the winner of the Kopa Trophy!

as.com

Eden Hazard is welcomed onto the stage and is speaking about his recent retirement from the beautiful game.

as.com

Drogba to tonight's nominees: "Thank you for being the best ambassadors."

as.com

All of tonight's nominees (male and female) are being welcomed onto the stage in pairs.

Bellingham and Haaland walk out together to applause from the crowd.

as.com

Didier Drogba and Sandy Heribert are presenting tonight's ceremony.

Drogba welcomes David Beckham and Gary Lineker to Paris.

as.com

We're live from Paris!

as.com

Last year's Men's top 3

1) Karim Benzema

2) Sadio Mané

3) Kevin De Bruyne

as.com

I'm still trying to get my head around Antoine Griezmann finishing 21st. How?

as.com

Inter Miami in the house

Arriving in style.

as.com

We're about to get underway in Paris!

Who is going to win tonight?

It's all about to be revealed!

as.com

The Messis

They return to the French capital after leaving Paris to move to Miami.

as.com

2023 Ballon d'Or

Bellingham and Vinícius pose together at tonight's gala in Paris.

as.com

Kylian Mbappé is next to shuffle through the carpet.

The 24-year-old scored goals (club goals) number 250 and 251 in PSG's 3-2 Ligue 1 win on Sunday.

He is likely to miss out this time around, but is quite probably a future Ballon d'Or winner.

as.com

The Messi family has arrived! They've come in later than most.

Tonight is expected to be Ballon d'Or number eight for the 2022 World Cup winner!

as.com

David Beckham is here. Paris is a city he knows quite well from his time at Paris Saint-Germain. The Inter Miami co-owner signs autographs and poses for selfies as he approaches the red carpet.

Beckham is well used to the cameras, as they flash in front of him on the red carpet in Paris. He has spent some time with Lionel Messi since the Argentine forward joined his club and will be hoping he clinches his eighth Ballon d'Or today. He recently admitted that it took several years to get the Messi to Miami deal over the line.

as.com

Where is the Ballon d'Or taking place?

The Ballon d’Or gala is taking place at the Théâtre du Châtelet in Paris, France.

The ceremony itself is expected to get underway at 3:45pm ET/12:45pm PT.

as.com

Haaland: "It's a great night"

Erling Haaland said a few words before tonight's gala.

as.com

"I'm really happy to have played in El Clásico, it was a really emotional game for me. It gives me goosebumps playing for Real Madrid!

"This award [Ballon d'Or] is one you think of winning when you're a kid."

Jude Bellingham, Real Madrid player

Real Madrid boys arrive

Real Madrid stars Jude Bellingham and Vinícius Júnior have arrived and it's fair to say they've put the effort into their suits tonight!

as.com

Yassine Bounou

A proud night for Bono!

as.com

Ballon d'Or trophy

In its current guise, the Ballon d’Or trophy - which, as its French name suggests, takes the form of a golden football - is widely reported to be worth somewhere in the region of €3,000 ($2,920). Including its pyrite base, the award measures 31 cm in height and 23 cm in diameter and weighs just over 7 kg.

Made with two brass plates that are soldered together to create the shape of a ball, the trophy is filled with a wax-like material and, on the outside, is bathed in gold.

as.com

Haaland in Paris

Erling is here. He had an outstanding season last year, scoring 52 goals in 53 games for City.

He also has 37 goals in 33 UEFA Champions League games.

He's 23!

as.com

Erling Haaland poses on the red carpet with his girlfriend and is followed by Manchester City team-mate Rodri.

The pair won the treble with City in 2022-23.

as.com

"It's going to be a great night with a lot of great footballers in the same room."

Erling Haaland, Man City striker

Salah finishes in 11th place

In case you missed it!

Liverpool forward Mo Salah has come 11th this year.

as.com

"I'm here at the awards because my kids asked me to come and we're going to spend the night together in Paris."

Eden Hazard, Former Real Madrid player

Hristo Stoitchkov

1994 winner Hristo Stoitchkov is in attendance this evening.

as.com

Women’s Ballon d’Or

In the Women’s Ballon d’Or, 50 journalists from across the globe select their top five players from a 30-strong shortlist, with the same points process applied as in the Men’s Ballon d’Or.

Spain's Aitana Bonmatí is in town and is expected to pick up the award tonight.

as.com

Khvicha Kvaratskhelia has turned up and poses on the red carpet with his partner.

The 22-year-old forward had an excellent 2022-23 campaign with Serie A winners Napoli.

as.com

How are the recipients of the Ballon d’Or awards decided?

For the Men’s Ballon d’Or, 100 journalists from around the world, each representing a different country in the top-ranked FIFA nations, are asked to choose five footballers from a 30-player shortlist, in descending order of merit.

The players on each journalist’s list are awarded points, as follows:

First: Six points

Second: Four points

Third: Three points

Fourth: Two points

Fifth: One point

The award then goes to the player who earns the highest amount of points in the voting process. If two or more players are tied on points, the number of first-place votes they received is used as a tie-breaker.

as.com

Mohamed Salah - 11th

Mohamed Salah misses out on the top 10 and finishes 11th this year.

as.com

Robert Lewandowski - 12th

Just in!

Barcelona striker Robert Lewandowski is 12th!

Will he be pleased with that?

as.com

Emi Martínez has landed, but there is still no sign of his compatriot Lionel Messi, the favorite to win tonight!

as.com

The guests are beginning to arrive at the Théâtre du Châtelet in Paris, and some are getting their photo taken on the red carpet ahead of the Ballon d'Or ceremony.

as.com

Yassine Bounou

Barcelona midfielder Ilkay Gundogan has been selected in 14th place, while another goalkeeper comes out next. This time, it's Morocco's Yassine Bounou, who ends up 13th, after his heroics at the World Cup in Qatar.

as.com

Real Madrid and Barcelona lead the men’s Ballon d’Or

The Ballon d’Or is indeed regarded as an individual accolade. However, Inter Miami is on the cusp of potentially joining the prestigious list of teams whose player has won the award for the best men’s player of the year presented by France Football.

With up to 67 awards having been bestowed (the inaugural gala was held in 1956, but it was exclusively for Europeans until 1995), clubs such as FC Barcelona (12), Real Madrid (12), AC Milan (8), Juventus (8), Bayern Munich (5), Manchester United (4), and Inter Milan (2) are among those whose players have clinched the award at some point.

as.com

World Cup winner

Aston Villa and Argentina goalkeeper Emi Martínez is out next, coming in 15th place.

Dibu, as he's known, won the World Cup with Argentina in Qatar, where he was pivotal for Lionel Scaloni's charges.

as.com

Top 15

We're now heading into the top 15 players for the 2023 Ballon d'Or...

as.com

Karim Benzema - 16th

Last year's winner - Karim Benzema - is 16th year.

Benzema scored 50 goals on the way to lifting the 2022 Ballon d'Or, was a LaLiga winner and also a Champions League winner.

The former Real Madrid man now plies his trade with Saudi side Al-Ittihad.

as.com

Djibril Cissé has landed and the former France forward is rocking his latest hairstyle. Never in doubt, Djibril.

as.com

BALLON D'OR

Who has won the Ballon d’Or more times, Messi or Ronaldo?

With Lionel Messi leading the way in Ballon D’Or wins, Portuguese striker Cristiano Ronaldo is the second most decorated player in Ballon d’Or history, with five titles won from 2008 to 2017.

as.com

Life must be pretty good for Jude right now!

A future Ballon d'Or winner? He is the favourite to land the Kopa Trophy later!

as.com

Jude Bellingham - 18th

It's the man of the moment. Bellingham has been exceptional for Real Madrid this season, with 13 goals in 13 games for Los Blancos.

He was also pretty good last season, almost guiding Borussia Dortmund to the Bundesliga title, until that devastating late collapse.

as.com

Kane in the top 20

Harry Kane gets into the top 20 for 2022-23. No real surprises there.

as.com

Griezmann at 21

Antoine Griezmann comes in at 21st. Griezmann is extremely underrated and is one of France's all-time greats as well as one of Atlético Madrid's all-time greats. He doesn't get the credit he deserves though. A brilliant footballer.

as.com

Where is the Ballon d'Or taking place?

The Ballon d’Or gala will take place at the Théâtre du Châtelet in Paris, France.

The red carpet event is scheduled to begin at 2pm ET/11am PT, while the ceremony itself is expected to get underway at 3:45pm ET/12:45pm PT.

as.com

Manchester United goalkeeper André Onana is out next in 23rd place, while Bayern Munich centre-back Kim Min-jae is in 22nd.

Onana has had a mixed start to life at Old Trafford but pulled off some exceptional saves against Manchester City on Sunday.

as.com

Bukayo Saka

In 24th place is Bukayo Saka, who has been superb for Arsenal.

The England winger is a key part of Mikel Arteta's side at the Emirates Stadium.

as.com

Josko Gvardiol

Man City's Josko Gvardiol is in at 25th!

as.com

Remember that in addition to the men’s and women’s Ballons d’Or, a number of other awards are to be presented at the gala. They include the Kopa Trophy, for the best under-21 men’s player, and the Yashin Trophy, for the best men’s goalkeeper.

as.com

Rankings revealed

The ranking reveal for the 2023 Men's Ballon d'Or has begun...

Manchester City captain Ruben Dias is 30th, while tied in 28th place are Arsenal captain Martin Odegaard and France forward Randal Kolo Muani.

Inter's Nicolo Barella is in 27th and the wonderfully gifted Jamal Musiala of Bayern Munich sits in 26th place.

as.com

BALLON D'OR

How many times has Messi won the men’s Ballon d’Or? Who has the most of all time?

Lionel Messi has won the men’s Ballon d’Or in 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012, 2015, 2019 and 2021.

No other player in history has received the award as often as the Barcelona legend, who spent a trophy-laden 17 seasons in the Blaugrana first team before leaving for a two-year spell at Paris Saint-Germain in 2021.

After Messi, the second-most frequent winner of the men’s Ballon d’Or is Cristiano Ronaldo, who has scooped the prize five times: in 2008, 2013, 2014, 2016 and 2017.

as.com

The 2023 Yashin Trophy nominees

Thibaut Courtois (Real Madrid)

Yassine Bounou (Al-Hilal)

Ederson (Manchester City)

Aaron Ramsdale (Arsenal)

Dominik Livakovic (Fenerbahçe)

Mike Maignan (AC Milan)

Brice Samba (RC Lens)

Emiliano Martínez (Aston Villa)

André Onana (Manchester United)

Marc-André ter Stegen (Barcelona)

as.com

The Yashin Trophy

The Yashin Trophy - named after Russian goalkeeper Lev Yashin - sees its winner be selected by former Ballon d’Or winners. The trophy is awarded to the best goalkeeper across the season.

The award, which was founded in 2019, was won by Liverpool’s Alisson Becker in its inaugural year, by Gianluigi Donnarumma in 2021 and by Thibaut Courtois in 2022. In 2020, France Football decided against handing out the award in a coronavirus-impacted year.

as.com

PSG

How many club goals has Kylian Mbappé scored in his career?

Kylian Mbappé was a key part of Paris Saint-Germain's Ligue 1 success last season, scoring 29 goals.

In an epic 2022 World Cup final in Qatar, Mbappé scored a hat-trick against Argentina to lift the Golden Boot award, with eight goals for France.

He may just fall short this time, but at 24, he does still have time on his side.

as.com

What did Erling Haaland do last season?

Eh, quite a lot!

Here's a look at Haaland's stats in 2022-23.

Haaland made 53 appearances for Manchester City last season and scored 52 goals in all competitions. An incredible first season at City, as you probably already know.

The Norwegian marksman was also the top scorer in the Premier League in 2022-23 with 36 goals, the highest-ever individual tally in a single season in the competition.

To add to the above, the former Borussia Dortmund star was the top scorer in the Champions League, netting 12 times in 11 games for Pep Guardiola's side, who went on to beat Inter in the final.

as.com

BALLON D'OR

Kopa Trophy: what is it, nominees and who has won it before

France Football has been awarding the Kopa Trophy since 2018, although in 2020, the magazine organisers decided against handing out the award in a coronavirus-impacted year.

There have been four winners thus far:

2022 - Gavi (Pablo Martín Páez Gavira)

2021 - Pedri (Pedro González López)

2019 - Matthijs de Ligt

2018 - Kylian Mbappé

as.com

What is the Super Ballon d’Or

The Super Ballon d’Or was awarded on 24 December 1989. The award was to commemorate the 30th anniversary of France Football Magazine.

Alfredo Di Stéfano

The great Alfredo Di Stéfano was the recipient of the prize, with the Argentinian pipping Johan Cruyff and Michel Platini in the vote. Only European players were considered for the award, and Di Stéfano was on the list of nominees due to his Spanish citizenship. The French publication, France Football, has only awarded the prize on one occasion.

Di Stéfano remains as the only player to have ever won the Super Ballon d’Or. The Real Madrid legend also won the actual Ballon d’Or award on two occasions in the 1950s, in 1957 and 1959, during an era of Real Madrid dominance. Di Stéfano helped Madrid to win the first five consecutive European Cups between 1956 and 1960.

as.com

PREMIER LEAGUE

Guardiola: Haaland and Messi should both win Ballon d’Or

Stanway laments Ballon d'Or timing

Speaking ahead of England's UEFA Nations League clash away to Belgium, Georgia Stanway questioned the timing of holding the Ballon d'Or with many women's teams across Europe preparing games in the competition.

"You want to feel like a star among the stars. We've got a game tomorrow, but if it was planned a little better then it would be easier for a lot of female footballers to be there."

Stanway is shortlisted in the Women's Ballon d'Or category.

as.com

2022 award winners: recap

Here's a look back at how the 2022 gala unfolded and a rundown of the winners per category.

Men's award: Karim Benzema

Women's award: Alexia Putellas

Kopa Trophy: Gavi

Yashin Trophy: Thibaut Courtois

Gerd Müller Trophy: Robert Lewandowski

Sócrates Award: Sadio Mané

Club of the Year: Manchester City

as.com

Ballon d'Or gala hosts

This year's ceremony will once again be hosted by former player Didier Drogba and as yet it's not confirmed if the Ivorian star will be joined again by Sandy Heribert (French television host) who co-presented the 2021 & 2022 edition with the former player.

as.com

Messi vs Haaland

Leo Messi and Erling Haaland are expected to be in contention for the 2023 Ballon d'Or men's award with our friends at SofaScore giving the Argentine a higher Opta stats rating over the Norwegian.

as.com

Deciding the Ballon d'Or

A select number of global journalists from are asked to vote for their top five players.

The criteria given to the media are:

Individual and collective performances during the year

Player class in terms of fair play and talent

An overall judgement of the player’s career

as.com

Yashin Trophy: nominees

Yassine Bounou (Sevilla/Al-Hilal/Morocco)

Thibaut Courtois (Real Madrid)

Mike Maignan (AC Milan)

Marc-André ter Stegen (Barcelona)

Ederson (Manchester City)

Emiliano Martínez (Aston Villa-Argentina)

André Onana (Inter Milan/Manchester United)

Aaron Ramsdale (Arsenal)

Dominik Livakovic (Croatia and Dinamo Zagreb)

Brice Samba (Lens)

as.com

Dibu and Bono, favourites for the Yashin Trophy

Real Madrid goalkeeper, Thibaut Courtois, aspires to repeat his victory in the last edition of the Yashin Trophy, although the Belgian is not the favorite this time. The two big favorites are Aston Villa keeper and World Cup winner with Argentina, Dibu Martínez and Morocco international and former Sevilla shot stopper, Yassine Bounou.

as.com

Who are the 2023 Kopa Trophy nominees?

Jude Bellingham (Real Madrid) - already lined up for the Golden Boy award

Gavi (Barcelona)

Jamal Musiala (Bayern Munich)

Eduardo Camavinga (Real Madrid)

Pedri (Barcelona)

Xavi Simons (RB Leipzig)

Alejandro Balde (Barcelona)

Antonio Silva (Benfica)

Rasmus Hojlund (Manchester United)

Elye Wahi (Lens)

as.com

Bonmatí and Paralluelo head to Paris

Spain internationals, Aitana Bonmatí and Salma Paralluelo make their way from Zurich (Spain play Switzerland in the Nations League on Tuesday) to Paris, ahead of the gala event.

as.com

Full Ballon d'Or nominees reminder

Here's the shortlist for both the men's and women's award.

Remember, as of 5:15 pm (CET) 10:15 am (ET), France Football will start the countdown from 30 backwards.

as.com

BALLON D'OR

2023 Ballon d’Or: how does the voting process work? Who has a vote?

as.com

Ballon d'Or 2023: women's favourites

Alexandra Popp - Wolfsburg/Germany

Popp is by far the most experienced player among this year’s candidates. Capped 133 times by Germany, she is the third top scorer of all-time for the national team with 66 goals. At club level, she is one of the most decorated players in the Frauen-Bundesliga having won the league seven times with Wolfsburg and finishing last season as the top scorer with 16 goals. Popp and her team lifted the DFB-Pokal Frauen in May - the club’s 10th title, a record. But there was disappointment in the Champions League - Popp was on target in the final, but Die Wölfinnen ended losing 3-2 to Barcelona. There was some consolation as she was voted Women’s Footballer of the Year for the first time.

as.com

Ballon d'Or 2023: women's favourites

Mary Earps - Man United/England

Keeper Mary Earps is another name cited as an outside favourite with the 30-year-old delivering a series of dazzling performances at the 2023 World Cup as the the Lionesses advanced to the final, only to succumb to an Olga Carmona goal as Spain lifted the title.

as.com

Ballon d'Or 2023: women's favourites

Aitana Bonmati - FC Barcelona/Spain

Midfielder Bonmatí, who starred for Spain as they clinched their first ever World Cup this summer in Australia, is tipped to succeed club and international team-mate Alexia Putellas as the winner of the Ballon d’Or Féminin in 2022. The 23-year-old has already been named UEFA Women’s Player of the Year and was instrumental in La Roja’s debut Women’s World Cup glory.

as.com

Ballon d'Or: global guide

Whether you're tuning into the awards from Shanghai, Miami or Buenos Aires, this handy tweet (X) post from the Ballon d'Or account has you covered in terms of start times.

as.com

Ballon d'Or 2023: men's favourites

Kylian Mbappé - PSG/France

Another solid favourite is Kylian Mbappe, who won the Golden Boot at the World Cup in Qatar, scoring eight times for France, including a hat-trick in the final. The fact Les Bleus ended up on the losing side could count against him, however, as might Paris Saint-Germain’s poor form for much of 2023 with the Parisians crashing out of the Champions League at the hands of Bayern Munich.

Ballon d'Or 2023: men's favourites

Erling Haaland - Man City/Norway

In any other year, Manchester City striker Erling Haaland would be a shoe-in for the award as the 23-year-old striker secured a historic treble (Premier League, FA Cup and Champions League) with City in his debut season with the English side scoring 52 goals across all competitions in his debut season for the club.

The Norwegian will undoubtedly grace future award ceremonies with City boss Pep Guardiola recently stating: “I always said that the Ballon d’Or had to be of two sections - one for Messi and one for the others. Haaland should win. We won the treble because he scored 52 goals but, of course, Messi - his worst season is the best of most players. Both deserve it”.

as.com

Ballon d'Or 2023: men's favourites

Leo Messi - Inter Miami/Argentina

Messi seems set to add to his collection of seven Ballon d’Or trophies on Monday night as the current MLS star appears set to be rewarded for leading Argentina to their first World Cup in 36 years - and The Herons to their first ever trophy with their 2023 Leagues Cup earlier this summer.

The Rosario native bagged seven goals at the Qatar 2022 World Cup and after the Albiceleste were stunned in their Lusail opener falling to Saudi Arabia (2-1), Messi led the way to the delight of the thousands of Argentine fans who made the trip to the Gulf to see the South American side add to their 1978 and 1986 triumphs.

- France Football to start counting down award rankings at 5:15pm CEST/10:15am ET

- Leo Messi is firm favourite to win an eighth men's Ballon d'Or

- Five other awards to be handed out in French capital

Ballon d'Or awards: timetable

Here is a breakdown of the timetable for tonight's ceremony:

Red Carpet - 1930 CET / 2:30 pm (ET) / 11:30 am (PT)

Ceremony - 2045 CET / 3:45 pm (ET) / 12:45 pm (PT)

2023 Ballon d'Or (debrief, speeches etc) - 2240 CET / 5:45 pm (ET) / 2:45 pm (PT)

as.com

The seven awards up for grabs tonight

In total, seven awards are due to be handed out in the French capital today. In addition to the men's and women's Ballons d'Or, we also have:

- the Yashin Trophy, for the world's outstanding men's goalkeeper

- the Kopa Trophy, for the best under-21 men's player

- the Müller Trophy, for the globe's top-performing men's striker

- the men's Club of The Year Award

- and the Socrates Award, which Ballon d'Or organisers France Football say “will identify the best solidarity actions carried out by committed champions”.

Tonight's venue is one of the French capital's hotspots for musicals with the cast and set of West Side Story having to take back stage tonight as the creme du la creme of the footballing world take centre stage in Paris.
